cair.graph

Class SeamCarving

  • java.lang.Object
    • cair.graph.SeamCarving

  • public abstract class SeamCarving
extends java.lang.Object
    All the method to perform the content aware image resizing

      • toGraph

        public static Graph toGraph(Image image)
        Generate a graph from an interest array
        Parameters:
        image -
        Returns:
        the associated graph
        See Also:

      • bfs

        public static boolean bfs(Graph gitr,
                          int root,
                          int target,
                          int[] parents)
        Perform a breadth-first search on a flow graph from a root to a target
        The parents array is filled as things progress such that the i-th value contains the parent index of the i vertex of the path.
        If i did not have any parent then the i-th value will contain BFS_PARENT_NONE.
        Parameters:
        gitr - The graphe to browse
        root - The origin of the path
        target - The destination of the path
        parents - Parents array
        Returns:
        true if the graph is saturated, false otherwise
        See Also:
        fordFulkerson(cair.graph.Graph)

      • fordFulkerson

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> fordFulkerson(Graph gitr)
        Perform the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm on the graph.
        At the end of the method, the graph is staturated, the cut (S,T) is determined and we can send the list of vertices u ∈ S such that :
        v ∈ T and (u,v) ∈ A, corresponding of the pixels we can get rid.
        Parameters:
        gitr - Graph to process
        Returns:
        the list of pixels to remove
        See Also:
        toGraph(cair.image.Image), bfs(cair.graph.Graph, int, int, int[]), verticesToPixelsPosition(cair.image.Image, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>)

      • verticesToPixelsPosition

        public static int[] verticesToPixelsPosition(Image image,
                                             java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> vertices)
        Convert the vertices index to positions in the image
        Note that on every line exactly one pixel will be remove.
        Then, we return the corresponding positions as a 1D array of a size equal to the height the image, where the i-th value contains the value on x of the position (a coordinate on the image is represented by i, arr[i])
        Parameters:
        image - Image used to generate the graph
        vertices - Vertices to convert
        Returns:
        the vertices positions in the image
        See Also:
        fordFulkerson(cair.graph.Graph), Image.removePixelsWidth(int[])

      • contentAwareResizing

        public static Image contentAwareResizing(Image image,
                                         int numberColumn,
                                         java.util.function.IntConsumer observer)
        Remove column in the image by performing the seam carving algorithm
        Parameters:
        image - Input image
        numberColumn - Number of column to remove
        observer - Notification function called each time a column is removed
        Returns:
        the reduced image
        See Also:
        toGraph(cair.image.Image), fordFulkerson(cair.graph.Graph), verticesToPixelsPosition(cair.image.Image, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>), Image.removePixelsWidth(int[])
